channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Be a Part of RPI’s Premier Cybersecurity Team!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The #1 collegiate cybersecurity CTF team in the country is looking for new players, so if you’d like to be part of the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory, just stop by Sage 3101 every Wednesday evening through the end of the semester! No experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and try new things. Contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: Outdoor Programming Group Schedules Rock-Climbing Event
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM - Help Outdoor Programming celebrate Outdoor Week with a trip to go rock climbing and clear your mind at Moss Island! Contact Will Weinert for more information.
item.author: Students

item.title: UPDATE: President’s Fall Town Meeting Rescheduled for October 24
item.description: Date: Thursday, October 24, 2024 3:00 PM - 4:30 PM - President Martin A. Schmidt ’81, Ph.D., invites all members of the campus community to attend the Fall Town Meeting, which will be held in the Curtis R. Priem Experimental Media and Performing Arts Center (EMPAC) theater.
item.author: Community

item.title: Hudson Valley Quantum Convening at RPI October 21
item.description: Date: Monday, October 21, 2024 9:30 AM - 11:00 AM - Register for this thought-provoking discussion about quantum computing, including what we have learned so far and the challenges and opportunities to come. The event will feature RPI President Martin A. Schmidt ’81; Congressman Paul Tonko; IBM Research Senior Vice President and Director Darío Gil; and West Point Vice Dean for Engagement and Research Kraig Sheetz.
item.author: Community

item.title: Be a Part of Black Families Technology Awareness Day 2025!
item.description: Scheduled for Saturday, February 1, Black Families Technology Awareness Day 2025 is designed to excite and engage K-12 students and their parents or guardians in science, technology, engineering, the arts and mathematics! Program proposals are being sought for the event and submissions are due by November 1; campus community members are invited to register through December 5 to volunteer. Please see the BFTAD website for more information.
item.author: Community

item.title: Physics, Applied Physics and Astronomy to Present Robert Resnick Lecture on October 16
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Rensselaer’s department of Physics, Applied Physics and Astronomy is pleased to host this lecture featuring Dr. R. Michael Barnett, of the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, who will present “Phantom of the Universe: The Hunt for Dark Matter.”
item.author: Community

item.title: AI/ML Research Reading Group Meetings to Begin October 2
item.description: If you’re interested in decoding complex AI/ML research, this group’s goal is to read and discuss diverse research papers in the interdisciplinary areas of AI/ML/NLP, IS, and HCI. Whether you’re a novice or a seasoned researcher, all RPI members are welcome to attend the group’s first meeting from 11AM to noon on October 2 in Pittsburgh 4114 to contribute to the discussions; the group will then meet bi-weekly. Contact Lydia Manikonda if you have questions!
item.author: Community

item.title: MSE Seminar Scheduled for October 16
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - This seminar will feature a presentation titled “Quantum Tomography of Light-Controlled Superconductivity” by Dr. Ilias Perakis, of the Department of Physics at the University of Alabama at Birmingham.
item.author: Community

item.title: DotCIO Announces Upcoming Changes to Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for Microsoft Services
item.description: Due to a change in how Microsoft and Duo communicate, effective October 16, 2024, there will be an update to the Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) interface for Microsoft services. As a result, users’ login experiences with Microsoft products such as Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Teams will change slightly.
item.author: Community

item.title: Collegiate Store Announces 20% Off Champion Clothing Sale
item.description: From October 10 through October 15, the Rensselaer Collegiate Store is having a 20%-off sale on Champion clothing and accessories! The discount will be taken at the register and some exclusions may apply; please visit the store for details.
item.author: Community

item.title: Faculty Seeking Feedback with Home Energy Efficiency Survey
item.description: Join a team of Rensselaer faculty who are helping to shape the future of eco-friendly home energy efficiency by developing siding material made from hemp that can boost home comfort and energy efficiency! Campus community members are invited to take a quick survey to provide feedback to help the team tailor this groundbreaking product.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Winning Foundation Grants” Topic of Faculty/Staff Workshop
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM - Faculty and staff are invited to join Foundation Philanthropy Director Cassie Riger and Sr. Foundation Philanthropy Officer Lori Jancik as they provide an overview of foundation funding, and best practices to apply for and win it! The Foundation Sponsored Research Series is designed for all experience levels. Please contact Jada Williams if you have any questions.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: TIAA Offering Confidential In-Person Retirement Counseling October 29
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 29, 2024 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. Attend this upcoming event to help you become better informed and more confident about Rensselaer’s retirement plan benefits!
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: 2024 Pillar of Rensselaer Nominations Now Open
item.description:
Nominations are currently being accepted for the 2024 Pillars Award, which is the highest and most prestigious award Rensselaer presents to a long-term member of the staff. Please view the list of eligible nominees and then use the available form to submit your nominations by Friday, November 8!…
